Class BattleFacade

java.lang.Object
battle.BattleFacade
public class BattleFacade extends Object
Week 13-04: Facade Pattern (SOLUTION) - INTEGRATED VERSION BattleFacade provides a simplified interface to the complex battle subsystems (Animation, Sound, UI) AND the BattleSystem. This Facade integrates: - BattleAnimationSystem (sprites, animations) - BattleSoundSystem (audio, music, SFX) - BattleUISystem (health bars, menus) - BattleSystem with State Pattern (actual battle logic) Benefits: 1. Client doesn't need to know subsystem internals 2. Client doesn't manage initialization order 3. Client uses simple, high-level methods 4. Subsystem changes don't affect clients 5. Single point of access to battle functionality The Facade coordinates all subsystems behind simple methods like: - startBattle() - executeBattle() - endBattle()

  • Constructor Summary

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    cleanupBattle()
    Cleanup battle - ONE call cleans up ALL subsystems! The Facade handles all cleanup internally.
    boolean
    executeBattle()
    Execute the full battle - ONE call runs the entire battle! This delegates to BattleSystem which uses State Pattern.
    void
    initializeBattle()
    Initialize battle - ONE call initializes ALL subsystems! The Facade handles all the complex initialization order internally.

    Play magic animation and sound - ONE call!

  • Constructor Details

    • BattleFacade

      public BattleFacade(Player player, boolean isDemoMode)
      Create a new BattleFacade. Subsystems are created but NOT initialized yet.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity
      isDemoMode - If true, boss only defends (for testing)

  • Method Details

    • initializeBattle

      public void initializeBattle()
      Initialize battle - ONE call initializes ALL subsystems! The Facade handles all the complex initialization order internally.

    • executeBattle

      public boolean executeBattle()
      Execute the full battle - ONE call runs the entire battle! This delegates to BattleSystem which uses State Pattern.
      Returns:
      true if player wins, false if player loses or runs

    • cleanupBattle

      public void cleanupBattle()
      Cleanup battle - ONE call cleans up ALL subsystems! The Facade handles all cleanup internally.

    • runFullBattle

      public boolean runFullBattle()
      Full battle sequence - ONE call does everything! Initialize → Execute Battle → Cleanup
      Returns:
      true if player wins, false if player loses or runs

    • playAttackEffects

      public void playAttackEffects(String attacker)
      Play attack animation and sound - ONE call!

    • playDefendEffects

      public void playDefendEffects(String defender)
      Play defend animation and sound - ONE call!

      Play magic animation and sound - ONE call!
